intro: Inga tubulifera, commonly known as the "Cupuaçu tree," is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces a fruit that resembles a large, green bean, which contains a rich, creamy pulp used in various food products. Its growth habit includes a climbing or shrub form, often found in the understory of dense forests. The plant has significant ecological and economic value due to its unique fruit and nitrogen-fixing abilities.
